definition: to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe

sentences.english: Now, the king remembered Zhuang Xin's words. He sent his men to fetch him.
sentences.chinese: 这时，他想起了庄辛的劝谏，于是派人接庄辛回来。

sentences.english: King Zhou increasingly dissolute without Road, outspoken minister was demoted to remonstrate both killed.
sentences.chinese: 纣王日益荒淫无道，大臣刚直劝谏者皆被杀被贬。

sentences.english: Therefore, some experienced and sensible ministers were always against it.
sentences.chinese: 因为狩猎活动耗财费物，因而有见识的大臣往往劝谏。

sentences.english: When parents are doing something that's wrong, counsel them to make them change.
sentences.chinese: 父母有过失，要劝谏他们，使他们变更。

sentences.english: If the counsel is not accepted, wait until parents are happy then counsel them again.
sentences.chinese: 如果劝谏不被接纳，父母心情愉快时再劝谏。

sentences.english: If the counsel is not accepted, wait until parents are happy then counsel them again.
sentences.chinese: 如果劝谏不被接纳，父母心情愉快时再劝谏。

definition: to put forward a suggestion (to sb in a senior position)/to offer a word of advice
(of a court official) to present a memorial to the emperor (old)
to remonstrate/to warn earnestly (esp. classical written Chinese)/to exhort
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
to hand down an imperial edict
